Obviously, anyone in charge of database performance would know what to do. The ubuntu/web-developer community is large enough that we can definitely use some tips in that area.

I think your most likely problem is that you are using a very hamstrung my.cnf. I suggest swapping out for either my-huge.cnf or my-innodb-heavy-4G.cnf. InnoDB if tuned correctly will give Drupal superior performance to MyISAM. InnoDB is also the default in MySQL 5.5 and later. The most important config changes to make are: innodb_flush_log_at_trx_commit = 0 innodb_flush_method = O_DIRECT # If on Linux or OS X, otherwise omit this line. innodb_buffer_pool_size = 512M # Make this as large as possible while still giving your machine enough RAM for other processes.
